root: ^Arkady put away his deck. The game was over. He turned to leave, but a tall man stepped out from the shadows, blocking his path.
^His face... his posture... even the way he moved... there was no doubt this was a former Red Army officer.
^There's no way you made it yourself. So where did you get it?
^Who are you? And why are you asking?
^The sign on the back of your cards, I recognize it. It belongs to somebody I know.
^We were in jail together. He taught me how to play Numbers, and gave me his deck.
^It all makes sense now. That man is always trying to teach and preach, no matter the circumstances.
^General Kojukh's son? Hah! I'll be damned! This is hilarious! Incredible!
^So they're imprisoning and killing everyone, literally everyone who helped them in the past!
^Oh my god. What an idiot I was to have trusted those people...
^...It all seems so irrelevant here, yet the past keeps on coming back...
^...Did Andreyev give you anything of value, by chance?
^No. The only thing he gave me was an old glove.
^Well, someone stole it from me last night.
^Of course. Fresh meat are easy prey for thieves. But we have to get the glove back, it's more valuable than you think.
^We'll talk about it later, not here. I have to go.
^Oh, one more thing. This coming week is going to be hard for you. Extremely hard.
^If you won anything today, visit the camp Kiosk and try to get something. Anything that will make your existence somewhat more bearable.
^The store is now available. You can purchase consumables to help you survive the camp.
